intro: Potentilla ossulana, commonly known as the alpine cinquefoil, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It is a low-growing perennial shrub that typically reaches a height of about 10–30 centimeters. The plant produces showy yellow flowers in clusters, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are palmately divided into five to seven lobes, giving it a distinctive appearance. Potentilla ossulana thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine meadows and slopes.
